item.title: Covid: Vaccines to be offered to 16 and 17 year olds
item.description: More than one million teenagers would be included in a new rollout if ministers accept expert advice.

item.title: Long-lasting Covid-19 symptoms rare in children
item.description: Children who become ill with coronavirus mostly recover in less than a week, research suggests.

item.title: MV Asphalt Princess: Ship hijacked off UAE ordered to sail to Iran
item.description: The Panama-flagged MV Asphalt Princess has been ordered to sail to Iran, officials say.

item.title: Belarus sprinter Krystina Timanovskaya flies out of Japan
item.description: Krystina Timanovskaya had refused orders to fly home early to Belarus and is now en route to Vienna.

item.title: Andrew Cuomo: Biden says governor should resign over harassment report
item.description: The new report comes months after several women accused the New York governor of sexual misconduct.

item.title: Gunmen attack home of Afghan defence minister in Kabul
item.description: The minister was not at home during the attack, which came rising unrest across the country.

item.title: FBI used pictures of staff for undercover sex crime stings
item.description: A watchdog says the FBI put office staff in danger by using their photos to lure sexual predators.

item.title: Timber shortage due to 'unprecedented' post-lockdown demand
item.description: Prices are rising sharply as climate change and post-lockdown DIY and building projects hit supplies.

item.title: Barbie of Oxford Covid vaccine designer Dame Sarah Gilbert created
item.description: Dame Sarah Gilbert says she found it "very strange" at first, but hopes it will inspire children.

item.title: The Papers: Jabs for over-16s, and 'King Kenny'
item.description: Wednesday's front pages report speculation Covid vaccines are to be offered to 16 and 17 year olds.

item.title: Beirut blast: ‘The day our city exploded’
item.description: One year on from the blast that rocked Beirut, no one has yet been made accountable.

item.title: CEO Secrets: Airbnb boss shares his business advice
item.description: Brian Chesky, co-founder and CEO of Airbnb, shares his business advice for the CEO Secrets series.

item.title: ‘I don’t want to spend my life on the streets’
item.description: Asma Shaikh, a 17-year-old homeless girl, has big dreams. But the pandemic has brought new challenges.

item.title: 'Witnessing my mum be abused by her ex-partner'
item.description: Betty Harper, 19, wrote a song the night her mum, Natasha, was beaten by her then-partner.

item.title: Assisted dying: Campaigners renewed hope for change in the law
item.description: David Peace intends to travel abroad to end his life before his motor neurone disease deteriorates further.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: New Zealand's Laurel Hubbard set to 'hang up her boots'
item.description: The transgender weightlifter made Olympic history but says her time in the sport is probably up.

item.title: Grandfather lands 'biggest ever cod' in Scottish waters
item.description: The fish caught off Shetland weighed in at 49lbs (22kg) and left 60-year-old Tony Urwin "shattered".

item.title: Tokyo 2020: 'You can take our flag but not our love for Russia'
item.description: Russia may be banned from the Olympics, but Russians are still winning medals – and rivals aren't happy.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics sparks anti-LGBT slurs on Russian TV
item.description: Gay and transgender athletes in Tokyo have been singled out for abuse on Russian state television.

item.title: Rett syndrome: My sister speaks to me without words
item.description: Sisters Victoria and Clare have a strong bond, but a rare syndrome means they have never spoken.

item.title: Barbra Streisand: 'I've always had the right to sing what I want'
item.description: The star looks back at her career, and explains how she's always maintained creative control.

item.title: Seasick swimmer makes history by completing Outer Hebrides challenge
item.description: James Armour has become the first person to swim, run and cycle the length of the Outer Hebrides.

item.title: The downfall of Nissan's Carlos Ghosn: An insider's view
item.description: Former Nissan lawyer Ravinder Passi had a ringside seat of the downfall of chairman Carlos Ghosn.

item.title: Abandoned by my friends when I was diagnosed with cancer
item.description: New research by the Teenage Cancer Trust finds some young people feel "abandoned" during treatment.

item.title: Amber-plus list: Why were extra travel restrictions imposed on France?
item.description: Why did ministers decide to retain quarantine for arrivals from France?

item.title: Indyref2: Why has the campaign for another vote gone quiet?
item.description: Boris Johnson heads to Scotland this week with no sign an independence referendum will be soon.

item.title: Men's 200m final and GB's 13-year-old medal hope - what to watch on day 12
item.description: Want to know what's happening when in Tokyo? Check out our comprehensive guide to all the action in Japan.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Sky Brown leads the way in park skateboarding heats
item.description: Watch Sky Brown's second run in the women's park heats at Ariake Sports Park as the British teenage sensation breezes through to the women's park skateboarding final.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: USA's Sydney McLaughlin sets a new 400m hurdles world record
item.description: USA's Sydney McLaughlin sets a new world record of 51.46 to beat Dalilah Muhammad to win the 400m hurdles at the Olympic Stadium in Tokyo.

item.title: 'I could tell straight away' - Referee Taylor reflects on moment Eriksen collapsed
item.description: Referee Anthony Taylor tells BBC Sport about the moment Denmark star Christian Eriksen collapsed after a cardiac arrest during Euro 2020.

item.title: Malmo stun Rangers in Champions League
item.description: A "big moment" from Steven Davis has given Rangers "an important lifeline" in their quest for the Champions League group stage despite defeat by Swedish side Malmo, says boss Steven Gerrard.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain beaten by Netherlands in hockey semi-finals
item.description: Watch highlights as Great Britain's hopes of defending their Olympic title are ended as they are beaten 5-1 by the Netherlands at the Oi Hockey Stadium.

item.title: 'They live for their sport and their little boy Albie' - GB's medal-winning power couple
item.description: Laura and Jason Kenny both win silver within 20 minutes of each other as they continue to cement their place in British Olympic history.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: 13-year-old Sky Brown wins Olympic skateboarding bronze
item.description: Sky Brown wins bronze in the women's park skateboarding final at the Tokyo Games as the 13-year-old becomes Great Britain's youngest Olympic medallist of all time.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: TikTok becomes the unofficial behind-the-scenes Olympic channel
item.description: The short-form video platform is giving fans unprecedented insight into the athletes' experience.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Katarina Johnson-Thompson third after two events in heptathlon
item.description: Katarina Johnson-Thompson lies third in the heptathlon after two events, after winning her 100m hurdles heat and clearing a height of 1m86 in the high jump.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Alice Dearing hopes representing GB 'makes a difference'
item.description: Alice Dearing hopes becoming the first black woman to represent Great Britain in an Olympic swimming event makes a difference and the sport is "available to anyone".

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Sydney McLaughlin smashes her 400m hurdles world record
item.description: USA's Sydney McLaughlin smashes her own world record as she takes gold in the women's 400m hurdles at the Tokyo Games.

item.title: Simone Biles: Tokyo 2020 medallist on 'unique Olympic experience'
item.description: American Simone Biles says she will "forever cherish" her "unique Olympic experience" after taking her overall Games medal haul to seven in Japan.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid rules: What has changed?
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: What are the holiday rules for travel to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: People vaccinated in Europe or the US will no longer need to isolate when arriving from amber countries.

item.title: Covid: What are the social distancing rules in England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland?
item.description: Social distancing rules are changing across the UK.

item.title: ‘Covid passports’: How to get the NHS Covid Pass
item.description: People in England can use the pass for travel and to visit venues which ask for them.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does the NHS test-and-trace system and app work?
item.description: A record number of alerts are being sent by the NHS Covid app.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: What are the Delta, Gamma, Beta and Alpha Covid variants?
item.description: UK coronavirus cases are rising due to a variant first identified in India that spreads more easily.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: New research links as many as 200 different symptoms to the condition.

item.title: Lockdown muscle loss: Five ways to get back in shape
item.description: Lockdown inactivity may have left people with weaker muscles - there are simple solutions.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: All over-18s can now get the Covid jab, but the government has criticised take-up among young people.
